A spatio-temporal point process (also called space-time or spatial-temporal point process) is a random collection of points, where each point represents the time and location of an event. Examples of events include incidence of disease, sightings or births of a species, or the occurrences of fires, earthquakes, lightning strikes, tsunamis, or volcanic eruptions. 
In this lesson, you will learn the basic concepts and methods of Spatio-temporal Point Patterns Analysis. You will also gain hands-on experience on using these methods to discover real-world point processes.

## Content

-   Spatio-temporal Point Processes
    -   Basic concepts of spatio-temporal point processes.
    -   Examples of real-world spatio-temporal point processes.
-   Spatio-temporal Point Patterns Analysis methods
    -   Spatio-temporal Kernel Density Estimation (STKDE)
    -   Spatio-temporal K-functions
